trial_identification.studytitle: Quantitative analysis of posture in patients with breast cancer related to actions of nursing and physiotherapy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Quantitative analysis of posture in patients with breast cancer related to actions of nursing and physiotherapy

interventions.interventions: The patients who attend a support center for women with breast cancer will be photographed immediately after surgery for tumor removal. The photographs will be repeated following the same standardization month after month until the end of the sixth month.In the first evaluation, patients will respond using a questionnaire semi-structured on the interventions of nursing in the periods before, during and after surgery. Receive guidance on basic nursing care and conduct weekly group exercises during six month. The exercises are carried out once a week for 1 hour under the supervision of a physiotherapist. These sessions involve exercises to improve shoulder range of motion, stretching exercises for upper and lower limbs and spine and circulatory exercises physiotherapist. The photographs will be analyzed by a computer program for analysis of postural changes and the postural changes will be quantified

primaryOutcome.outcome: To compare the posture of women who have had surgery to remove a breast tumor
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Immediately after surgery and monthly until the sixth month after surgery

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To compare the range of motion in the arms of women who have had surgery to remove a breast tumor using photogrammetry
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Immediately after surgery and monthly until the sixth month after surgery using photogrammetry

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Women who participate in the support center for women with breast cancer the Federal University of Alfenas in 2011-2012, which have recently undergone surgery to remove the tumor in the breast
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Women who do not agree to participate. Women who are already doing exercises support center for women with breast cancer the Federal University of Alfenas in the last year

trial_design.concealment: To participate in the study were considered all women who start the treatment at the Department of Education, Research and Extension Women and breast cancer during this study

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study aims to quantitatively assess the posture of mastectomy patients. All volunteers have your posture evaluated initially by photogrammetry, after participating in a weekly attendance of a group of women with breast cancer that are oriented to care for post-surgical nurses and posture, and perform exercises supervised by physiotherapists. After six months of treatment are the same patients are photographs again with the same standardized initially and their posture reassess
